alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:25AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, north central Brown and western Keya Paha Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 525 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Keyapaha, or 18 miles northeast of Valentine, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springview, Norden, Meadville, North River Trail, Sparks and Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 213 and 225. Highway 12 between mile markers 15 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
